intro: Kleinia jorullensis, commonly known as the Jorullén rosebay, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, Kleinia jorullensis is a notable species in the flora of the Canary Islands.
